issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Add GenericTestUtils.getTestDir method and use it for temporary directory in tests

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Every jenkins build report contains 'asflicence warnings' due to test files being created in "hadoop-hdfs/build" instead of 'target' directory.
Fix tests which creates files in "hadoop-hdfs/build" directory.
fields.summary: Fix ASF Licence warnings in Jenkins reports

This message was automatically generated.
{{TestMiniDFSCluster.java}} and {{TestHostsFiles.java}} creates files in "hadoop-hdfs/build" directory,Uploaded the patch ,kindly review..

{quote} -1	asflicense	0m 29s	Patch generated 2 ASF License warnings.{quote}
Fixed the above two warnings which are in {{TestBlocksWithNotEnoughRacks}}..Bytheway without this patch there are 57+ warnings..

[~stevel@apache.org], this overlaps somewhat with your HDFS-9263 patch, but I'd like to try to proceed quickly with Brahma's patch here, since it's smaller in scope compared to what you're doing in HDFS-9263.  Do you have any objections?

[~brahmareddy], I haven't read the patch yet, but I see there were 2 license warnings remaining in the last Jenkins run.  Could you please take a look at fixing those?  Thank you!

chris, I've been too busy to finish off '9263, even though its the hadoop branch I'm hooked up.

get this one in first

[~stevel@apache.org], thanks for the go-ahead.

[~brahmareddy], I just noticed that you also posted a 002 patch with a fix for the decom tests, and Jenkins hasn't run on that one yet.  I'll keep watching for the results to come back on that one.

Thank you Brahma for taking care of this. +1 for pushing this

Jeez, the tests...  I went through the typical round of verifying that none of those failures are related to this patch.

+1 for patch v002.  I have committed this to trunk, branch-2 and branch-2.8.  Brahma, thank you for the patch.  Uma, thank you for helping with the review.
